answers.answer: I have dealt with this with my 2nd baby and lyckily it was just my sodium intake causing the swelling. I highly suggest avoiding salt and drink lots of water to flush those kidneys out. You really do need to get a hold of ur OB soon though because there are other things like preeclampsia that cause major swelling. Take care

question: I'm 15 weeks with baby# 2  and woke up today feeling absolutely awful I also have swollen face and hands I tried to call my doctor but with no success they have yet to answer so I was wondering has any one else had this it didn't happen with my daughter so just concerned
title: 15 weeks and swollen face and hands
